thread.title: Cyberespionage group caught borrowing banking malware code
thread.title_full: Cyberespionage group caught borrowing banking malware code

title: Cyberespionage group caught borrowing banking malware code
text:
Cyberespionage group caught borrowing... Cyberespionage group caught borrowing banking malware code Next Story Prev Story 2 min ago Read more: ComputerWorld 
A group of hackers that target military and government organizations has recently borrowed code from an old online banking Trojan called Carberp, further blurring the line between cybercrime and cyberespionage. The hacker group is known by various names in the security industry, including Pawn Storm and APT28. Start the conversation, or Read more at ComputerWorld.
